oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1939-10-14 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from October 14, 1939. Featuring David Stone (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Uncle Dave Macon and son Dorris Macon, George Wilkerson and his Fruit Jar Drinkers, DeFord Bailey, and Rachel Veach and Bashful Brother Oswald. First NBC broadcast, held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Uncle Dave Macon; Dorris Macon; George Wilkerson; Fruit Jar Drinkers; DeFord Bailey
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) Station announcements [incomplete] / (0:30) David Stone announces the opening statements / (0:43) Opening theme / (1:44) David Stone introduces George D. Hay / (1:54) George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys / (2:16) Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys perform "Ida Red" / (3:53) David Stone announces a Prince Albert commercial / (4:37) George D. Hay introduces Uncle Dave Macon and Dorris Macon / (4:56) Uncle Dave Macon and Dorris Macon perform "Cannon County Hills" / (7:05) George D. Hay introduces George Wilkerson and his Fruit Jar Drinkers / (7:20) George Wilkerson and his Fruit Jar Drinkers perform "Up Jumped The Devil" / (8:40) George D. Hay introduces DeFord Bailey / (8:50) DeFord Bailey performs "Pan American Blues" / (9:50) George D. Hay reads a message from Tennessee State Governor Prentice Cooper / (10:32) David Stone reads a message from Gene Autry / (11:00) George D. Hay reads a message from Birmingham, Al. Congressman Luther Patrick / (11:30) George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys / (11:40) Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys perform "The Great Speckled Bird" / (14:35) David Stone announces a Prince Albert commercial / (15:11) George D. Hay introduces Uncle Dave Macon / (15:22) Uncle Dave Macon performs "Nobody's Darling But Mine" [incomplete] / [continued in part 2; TR000002]
